raw_data.title: Accounting Technician I
raw_data.description: This position is responsible for performing one or more routine accounting clerical operations such as: examining, verifying, and correcting various accounting documents to ensure completeness and accuracy of data in accordance to accounting procedures. Specific tasks/duties are assigned under adequate supervision. Entry-level reconciliation and posting will be assigned under detailed guidance. In most instances, an employee in this position will rely on the supervisors’ instructions. Completed work will be reviewed for accuracy and compliance with procedures. The Accounting Clerk performs one or more accounting tasks such as; posting to registers and ledgers; balancing and reconciling accounts; verifying the internal consistency, completeness, and mathematical accuracy of accounting documents. In addition, tasks include; assigning prescribed accounting distribution codes; examining and verifying the clerical accuracy of various types of reports, lists, calculations, and postings. This position is responsible for preparing journal vouchers; making entries of adjustments to accounts; and working with spreadsheets. Ability to perform a range of invoice processing tasks and functions. Ability to utilize office automation software applications. Ability to provide customer service. Ability to communicate in writing. Ability to communicate effectively other than in writing. Ability to work independently.
raw_data.education_and_experience_substitution: Two (2) years of experience is equal to an Associate’s Degree, four (4) years of experience is equal to a Bachelor’s Degree, six (6) years of experience is equal to a Master’s Degree, and vice versa.

raw_data.title: Accountant I
raw_data.description: This position will work closely with the Section and Branch Chief to help document and analyze current standard operating procedures. Employee will perform entry level audit assignments, participate as a team member in planning and executing audits, working under the direction of senior auditors. Supporting and executing the Branch's functions and mission; Identifying any gaps in current standard operating procedures documentation; Creating standard operating procedure documentation as needed; and Researching, analyzing, and identifying modernization opportunities and provide actionable recommendations to management. Prepares balance sheets, profit and loss statements, and other financial reports. Reports organization's finances to management, and offers suggestions about resource utilization, tax strategies, and assumptions underlying budget forecasts. Ability to analyze trends, costs, revenues, financial commitments, and obligations incurred to predict future revenues and expenses. Strong communication and interpersonal skills; detail oriented, strong organizational and written skills and strong problem-solving/analytical skills; proficient in Excel/Access. Experience performing accounting operations which includes experience applying accounting theories and practices as recognized in public and private sector accounting in the United States.

raw_data.title: Administrative Specialist I
raw_data.description: In addition to secretarial duties (filing, taking phone calls, scheduling appointments, making travel arrangements), this position will provide administrative support to executive staff with office management responsibilities to include budgeting, personnel records and payroll. The Administrative Assistant may be required to work independently on projects requiring research and preparation of presentation materials. Preforms a variety of administrative tasks based on instruction and guidelines. Provides support to office staff, receives telephone calls and visitors coming into the office and route them accordingly to the appropriate personnel. Reviews all incoming correspondence, distributes to necessary staff members as appropriate, prepares replies to general inquires and routine actions. Maintains office files and ensures they are current and updated periodically. Maintains office calendars and appointment/meeting schedules. Coordinates and arranges various meetings and conference events in the local area. Prepares agendas for meetings and conferences, and accurately documents and publishes summary of minutes from meetings and conferences. May make travel arrangements for various staff members. Must have excellent oral and written communication skills; Strong customer service orientation, detail oriented, and possess excellent organizational skills; Must be able to comprehend simple instructions and construct short correspondence and/or memos; Strong interpersonal, listening, problem solving, and telephony skills are required; Must maintain high levels of integrity and discretion; Ability to manage multiple tasks within strict deadlines is required. Familiar with Microsoft Office.
raw_data.education_and_experience_substitution: Two (2) years of experience is equal to an Associate’s Degree, four (4) years of experience is equal to a Bachelor’s Degree, six (6) years of experience is equal to a Master’s Degree, and vice versa.

labor_categories.years_experience: Two (2) years of experience is equal to an Associate’s Degree, four (4) years of experience is equal to a Bachelor’s Degree, six (6) years of experience is equal to a Master’s Degree, and vice versa.

raw_data.title: Audit Consultant I
raw_data.description: This position is to provide a continuing independent review of financial, accounting, and/or management operations and controls to ensure that funds, personnel, equipment, and processes are employed efficiently, effectively, and securely, in full compliance with relevant administrative, policy, and regulatory guidelines and laws. The employee will review the effectiveness of financial operations and systems in meeting the department’s financial management goals and objectives, management initiatives, and agendas. Perform professional auditing and program review duties in monitoring, reconciling and overseeing broad-ranging financial functions carried out in connection with corporate financial management activities, including global accounting, disbursing, and compensation operations; Identify and review operating procedures and processes to determine compliance, adequate financial controls, and opportunities for improvement. This includes audit plan development and execution for the travel oversight program, overseas disbursing and cashier monitoring program, and domestic and overseas payment recapture programs, pursuant to the Improper Payments Information Act (IPIA) requirements, as amended; Work independently and with audit teams to effectively develop, execute, summarize, and present audit and review findings.; Prepare and deliver concise briefing and presentation material, orally and in writing, for management; Review and analyze federal legislation, regulations and policies to provide management with substantive analyses and recommendations and to ensure adherence to such laws, regulations and policies. Proficient in Microsoft applications (Word, Excel, Visio); Strong interpersonal skills; Ability to effectively facilitate team and client meetings; Ability to deliver informative, well-organized presentations to senior level decision maker.
raw_data.education_and_experience_substitution: Two (2) years of experience is equal to an Associate’s Degree, four (4) years of experience is equal to a Bachelor’s Degree, six (6) years of experience is equal to a Master’s Degree, and vice versa.

labor_categories.years_experience: Two (2) years of experience is equal to an Associate’s Degree, four (4) years of experience is equal to a Bachelor’s Degree, six (6) years of experience is equal to a Master’s Degree, and vice versa.

The employee will review the effectiveness of financial operations and systems in meeting the department’s financial management goals and objectives, management initiatives, and agendas. Perform professional auditing and program review duties in monitoring, reconciling and overseeing broad-ranging financial functions carried out in connection with corporate financial management activities, including global accounting, disbursing, and compensation operations; Identify and review operating procedures and processes to determine compliance, adequate financial controls, and opportunities for improvement. This includes audit plan development and execution for the travel oversight program, overseas disbursing and cashier monitoring program, and domestic and overseas payment recapture programs, pursuant to the Improper Payments Information Act (IPIA) requirements, as amended; Work independently and with audit teams to effectively develop, execute, summarize, and present audit and review findings.; Prepare and deliver concise briefing and presentation material, orally and in writing, for management; Review and analyze federal legislation, regulations and policies to provide management with substantive analyses and recommendations and to ensure adherence to such laws, regulations and policies. Proficient in Microsoft applications (Word, Excel, Visio); Strong interpersonal skills; Ability to effectively facilitate team and client meetings; Ability to deliver informative, well-organized presentations to senior level decision maker.

raw_data.title: Business Specialist I
raw_data.description: This position is to provide a variety of analytical and operational services in support of constituency outreach, strategic partnership building, and communications activities to the department, as well as serve as a policy advisor. Includes telephone & email prospecting new customers by generating business leads, developing and delivering client proposals, and following up with prospective clients; Creates individual account development plans detailing objectives, timelines and sales methods to support the defined account strategies; Accurately identifies the level of influence and decision making power of contacts in the customer organization to secure business opportunities; Ability to develop presentations with targeted messages. Comfortable making presentations remotely to include key decision makers. Establishes, enhances and maintains productive quality working relationships with clients and sales team members. Demonstrates strong and effective customer service and relationship-building skills; Ability to develop rapport with a variety of external clients, and effectively collaborate with regional influences; Ability to work independently; capable of taking ownership of assigned tasks, and nurturing client opportunities; Creates quarterly plans and actions to successfully achieve/exceed targets; Demonstrates a proactive and enthusiastic attitude in striving for and meeting business goals and objectives; Recognizes the need for and demonstrates good communication and listening skills with clients, customers, and employees.

raw_data.title: Financial Analyst I
raw_data.description: The Financial Analyst will produce high quality financial performance information necessary to implement effective policy, management, and operational decisions; and can perform the necessary financial and budgetary functions to support day-to-day operations. He/she must have the ability to work effectively independently and as a team member. They must efficiently and effectively organize and prioritize multiple tasks, be responsive to a variety of stakeholders, and maintain independence in resolving conflicting time restraints. They must also possess strong interpersonal and organization skills, in conjunction with the ability to exercise initiative, judgment and discretion. Responsible for providing analytical services, staff expertise, program budget support, budget advisory services and coordination of budget issues and requirements related to the operations. Responsible for working with the program and budget staff on a variety of issues such as financial analysis, budget justifications, audit responses, reports, and expenditure projections. Plans, develops, coordinates, and guides budget responsibilities within the area of assignment. Participates in the technical evaluation, pricing analysis, and negotiation of contract awards; and participates with contracting representatives in developing justifications for contract awards. Must have proven skill in manipulating and analyzing financial or economic data and using quantitative techniques. Strong analytical skills; Communication skills; Strong computer skills; Ability to work independently or in a team setting; Strong decision-making skills; Detail oriented; Ability to manipulate and analyze financial or economic data and using quantitative techniques. Experience performing financial analysis and evaluation which includes corporate and public finance, financial management structures, operations, practices and/or procedures; and developing tentative conclusions and/or initial recommendations for financial management problems.

raw_data.title: General Clerk I
raw_data.description: The General Clerk follows clearly detailed procedures in performing simple repetitive tasks in the same sequence. Responsibilities would include filing pre-coded documents in a chronological file, or operating office equipment, (e.g., mimeograph, photocopy, addressograph or mailing machine). This position follows clearly detailed specific procedures in completing several repetitive clerical steps performed in a prescribed or slightly varied sequence, such as coding and filing documents in an extensive alphabetical file; could involve simple posting to individual accounts, opening mail, calculating and posting charges to departmental accounts, operating basic office equipment, e.g., photocopier, facsimile, multi-line phone/voicemail systems, mailing machines, and minimal computer programs. Little or no subject-matter knowledge is required, but the clerk uses his or her own judgment in choosing the proper procedure for each task. This position requires familiarity with the terminology of the office unit. The General Clerks elects appropriate methods from a wide variety of procedures or makes simple adaptations and interpretations of a limited number of substantive guides and manuals. The clerical steps often vary in type or sequence, depending on the task. Recognized problems are referred to others. Requires a knowledge of routine clerical methods, office practices and procedures as they relate to position, as well as a basic knowledge of basic office equipment and multiline phone system. Ability to perform a range of office tasks and functions. Ability to utilize office automation software applications. Ability to provide customer service. Ability to communicate effectively both orally and written. Ability to work independently.

raw_data.title: Grants Coordinator I
raw_data.description: The Grant Coordinator will provide grant audit and close out support to meet the needs of customers in a timely and efficient manner and should possess a mid-level skill set in both grants management as well as understanding the grants close out processes to assist in meeting its mission responsibilities. The coordinator will serve as an adviser in negotiating and resolving complex disputes. Under direction, the Grant Coordinator shall ensure that “Grant Closeouts” are conducted in a collaborative manner between the GO, Financial Management Officer/Budget Officer (FMO/BO), and Grants Officer Representative (GOR). Maintain continuous contact with all stakeholders throughout the grants closeout process to ensure timely recognition and resolution of any issues that may impede the release of the final report(s); Provide guidance to Grant Officer that includes a summary of required action, and a recommended strategy required to close out the Grant File; provide strategies for consideration in resolving various issues, document the process and basis for the recommended action; assist Grant officers with the Grant administration activities in accordance with applicable U.S. laws and regulations; identify Grants complete by “grantee” and period of performance for each; shall provide a quarterly status report on Grants in the process of closeout; prepare a brief to assess whether the completed Grant meets the criteria for a closeout; verify that all Final Financial Reports are submitted in a timely manner; and ensure that grantees are in compliance with agreement terms and conditions; Provide guidance and instructions to grantees on filling out the required financial reports; research problems where the balance reported by a grantee did not match the balances. Working knowledge of Negotiated Indirect Cost Rates Agreement (NICRA); knowledge of Closeout procedures for different type of Federal Grants; have extensive experience in researching, collecting and presenting information involving Grant related issues to Grant officers, program managers, and upper management; possess a general knowledge of the industry-leading practices and standards used to close out completed grants. Experience in the field of Grants Management.

Working knowledge of Negotiated Indirect Cost Rates Agreement (NICRA); knowledge of Closeout procedures for different type of Federal Grants; have extensive experience in researching, collecting and presenting information involving Grant related issues to Grant officers, program managers, and upper management; possess a general knowledge of the industry-leading practices and standards used to close out completed grants. raw_data.title: Logistics Management Specialist I
raw_data.description: Analyze and coordinate an organization’s supply chain—the system that moves a product from supplier to consumer. Will manage the entire life cycle of a product, which includes how a product is acquired, distributed, allocated, and delivered. Oversee activities that include purchasing, transportation, inventory, and warehousing. Direct the movement of a range of goods, people, or supplies, from common consumer goods to military supplies and personnel. Use software systems to plan and track the movement of products. Operate software programs designed specifically to manage logistical functions, such as procurement, inventory management, and other supply chain planning and management systems. Direct, develop or perform logistics management operations involving planning, coordinating, or evaluating logistical actions required to support a specified mission, or other designated program. Perform periodic independent systems evaluations and develop recommendations for improvements based on a thorough and comprehensive study and analysis. Schedule and monitor funding milestones for adequacy and timeliness. Monitor organizational and contractor compliance with milestone and system performance criteria. Collaborate and plan with other managers and appropriate personnel to coordinate and/or integrate operations and interests of other organizations. Responsible for planning, managing and coordinating the total cradle-to-grave life cycle logistics support for assigned systems or subsystems, integrating separate functions of supply, maintenance, procurement and quality assurance into logistics activities required to sustain system fielding. Gather facts and develop conclusions relative to any matter having a significant impact on solutions to problems requiring command attention because of their criticality of involvement with high-level policy. Exercise technical leadership to obtain agreement on required actions, schedules and the resolution of conflicting points of view concerning program or policy matters. Experience planning and carrying out projects to improve efficiency and productivity of organizations and employees in administrative support activities, established logistics management, program analysis operations and programs or planning, coordinating, training, evaluating units and resolving substantive issues pertaining to mobility and logistics. Strong communication skills ability to collaborate with colleagues, do business with suppliers and customers. Must develop, adjust, and carry out logistical plans that help reduce cost and increase efficiency. Strong organizational skills. Strong problem-solving skills.

raw_data.title: Management Analyst I
raw_data.description: To provide Acquisition support services for commercial and non-commercial items in support of internal and external customers. To provide many pre and post award functions involving specialized procurements of significant importance to the agency. Requirements typically involve systems or programs such as: Professional Support Staffing Services, Research, development and production of extensive specialized equipment or systems. Identifies within assigned major program(s) those large-scale subsystems, components, equipment, and services to be acquired by contract. Develops procurement objectives for the program in terms of competition and price range, and constructs the contractual vehicle including use of pricing arrangements, subcontracting policy, best-aside polices and similar consideration. Prepares and maintains current acquisition plans, appropriate mile-stone charts and related schedules. Serves as advisor to program officials in procurement planning. Advises program officials of the procurement objectives to be used and assists in the preparation of statements of work. Prepares determinations and fining and solicitation documents. Performs details analyses of all elements of cost in contractor proposals and makes competitive range determinations. Coordinates with program officials in understanding of what is required under the proposed modifications to clarify questions concerning such topics and specification changes, language ambiguities or clarification of contract clauses. As required by the lack of meaningful cost and price information, explores new or innovative contracting approaches to arrive at an equitable contract arrangement. Assist the Government with negotiation strategy, coordinates strategy with negotiation team and assist the Government with the negotiations which are conducted with contractors to develop the contract prices and terms. Prepare the pre-award documents for contract award. Performs contract administration. Responsibilities typically include incremental funding, preparation of cost adjustments, coordination of timely extensions, incorporation of change orders, monitoring of Government property reporting, prepare contract modification for final payment and contract closeout. Prepare the contract modification for Termination for the convenience of the Government of default by the contractor for the Government’s Contracting Officers’ approval. Strong interpersonal skills. Must possess strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to gather pertinent facts, make thorough analyses and arrive and sound conclusions. Strong organization and planning skills. Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task and prioritize work.

raw_data.title: Price/Cost Analyst I
raw_data.description: The position is responsible for providing cost- and price-related support and advice to contracting offices and program offices in these areas; conducting comprehensive cost analyses for critical acquisitions; analyzing contractor costs and ensuring that they align with cost estimates; and recommending new policies and business processes to achieve greater efficiency in the Department’s acquisition functions. Cost Analysis - Performs cost and price analyses on competitive and non-competitive multiple-year procurement actions for major programs, systems acquisitions, and contract actions valued in the multi-million and multi-billion-dollar ranges using a wide variety of conventional and cutting edge price and cost analysis techniques and tools. Prepares reports of findings on these high-interest actions that include actual and potential issues and problems along with strategies to address and resolve them, lessons-learned, and recommendations for improving future acquisitions, negotiating more advantageous cost and price mechanisms, and implementing efficiencies to drive down costs. Provides expert advice to senior management, customers, and other acquisition professionals in the areas of: review of cost/price proposals; review of supporting documentation; and writing cost and price analyses. Leads discussions on cost/price issues with senior acquisition, program, and/or contractor officials, and resolves complex and/or costly problems. Pre-Award - Develops contractual pricing arrangements and incentives such as multiple incentives requiring use of sophisticated costing techniques; sharing arrangements, such as cost-plus-incentive-fee or fixed-price incentive fee, where the Government and the contractor share the cost risk; or economic price adjustment clauses that identify the basis for adjusting certain labor or material costs where price cannot be reasonably predicted at the time of contract negotiation. Recommends the development of cost/price terms and related terms in solicitations and contracts and negotiates these terms with vendors and other parties. Evaluates contractor responsibility, financial soundness, and past performance, costs of previous procurements, and related factors to determine the cost effectiveness of various bids and identifies potential problems that could occur. Post-Award - Conducts systematic and comprehensive cost assessments of acquisitions to ensure that contractor costs are consistent with cost estimates submitted and that incentives are awarded properly. Where appropriate, investigates inappropriate variances; identifies reasons; and prepares and negotiates solutions with customers and vendors. Develops new approaches and strategies for collecting and validating cost data. Coordinates requests for audits among external audit agencies (e.g., Defense Contract Audit Agency), and internal acquisition and program staff. Reviews audit reports, reports results, and makes recommendations to the Contracting Officer. Requ

raw_data.title: Program Manager I
raw_data.description: Program Manager achieves operational objectives by contributing information and recommendations to strategic plans and reviews; preparing and completing action plans; implementing production, productivity, quality, and customer-service standards; resolving problems; completing audits; identifying trends; determining system improvements; implementing change. Participates in, coordinates, and/or manages agency programs and projects. Identifies and resolves problems related to agency programs or services. Performs duties in support of the information, internal communications, and liaison activities for an organizational program. Acts as liaison with persons or groups within and/or outside of the organization to disseminate information about program requirements. Plans and/or accomplishes special projects. Develop new programs and grants to meet strategic and precise needs within organization. Plan ways to incorporate strategic plan resource initiatives/requirements into the budget. Accomplish human resource objectives by recruiting, selecting, orienting, training, assigning, scheduling, coaching, counseling, and disciplining employees; communicating job expectations; planning, monitoring, appraising, and reviewing job contributions; planning and reviewing compensation actions; enforcing policies and procedures. Knowledge of the functions, processes, and principles of management (e.g., management practices, theories, and methodology of management) sufficient to organize and develop analyses or studies that will lead to improvement of overall operations. Expertise in interpersonal skills to meet and deal effectively with others at all levels of authority and exert a positive influence. Extensive experience in communicating complex and technical information orally and in writing. Experience in program policy and guidance; dispute mediation, conciliation and resolution; program planning and management work.

raw_data.title: Project Analyst I
raw_data.description: The Project Analyst will propose ways to improve efficiencies throughout the project. Will serve as an advisor on how to reduce cost and increase efficiencies as applicable to each specific project. Gather’s and organizes information about the problem to be solved or the procedure to be improved. Develop solutions or alternative practices. Recommends changes as needed through presentations or written reports. Assists in the preparation of oversight reports for upper management as well as writes, and edits reports that are accurate, timely and suitable for the intended audience, occasion and purpose. The end product should be ready for release with little or no rewriting required. Gathers historical, statistical, funding and other data in the preparation of a comprehensive report that gives consideration to the audience, strategic messages, and topics; determines the most logical and effective use of information; and ensures all appropriate safeguards are maintained regarding sensitive or classified information. Adheres to established report production procedures and guidelines; provides supporting documentation, cross references or other information; makes recommendations and offers conclusions with justification; identifies potential areas of disagreement with the area being reviewed and makes recommendations to minimize formal non-concurrences; considers and resolves issues on factual matters to ensure balanced and accurate results; develops and implements follow-up plans to track implementation of oversight work results; and tracks and reports on follow-up activities, as required. Utilizes the knowledge of the work product and planned programs to assist senior leaders in the preparation and presentation of complex materials or highly complex issues before a wide variety of audiences. When tasked, will undertake special studies, direct projects, and carry out assigned missions of the very highest priority, many of which are of direct concern to the agency. In this connection, incumbent is relied upon to plan, direct, coordinate, and expedite projects and actions appropriate for each assignment. Establishes and maintains highly effective working relationships with all stakeholders. Analyze financial and other data, including revenue, expenditure, and employment reports. Conduct onsite observations to determine the methods, equipment, and personnel that will be needed. Excellent writing and editing skills are required to provide comprehensive support to the production of complex and comprehensive publications. Must be able to identify, gather, and evaluate data; identify source documents and prepare requests for information; provide support and have the ability to analyze and evaluate multi-national program operations. Knowledge of qualitative and quantitative analysis techniques to conduct data calls and perform research. Proficiency in analyzing data and information to identify issues and develop conclusions and recommendations.

raw_data.title: Project Analyst IV
raw_data.description: The Project Analyst will propose ways to improve efficiencies throughout the project. Will serve as an advisor on how to reduce cost and increase efficiencies as applicable to each specific project. Gather’s and organizes information about the problem to be solved or the procedure to be improved. Develop solutions or alternative practices. Recommends changes as needed through presentations or written reports. Assists in the preparation of oversight reports for upper management as well as writes, and edits reports that are accurate, timely and suitable for the intended audience, occasion and purpose. The end product should be ready for release with little or no rewriting required. Gathers historical, statistical, funding and other data in the preparation of a comprehensive report that gives consideration to the audience, strategic messages, and topics; determines the most logical and effective use of information; and ensures all appropriate safeguards are maintained regarding sensitive or classified information. Adheres to established report production procedures and guidelines; provides supporting documentation, cross references or other information; makes recommendations and offers conclusions with justification; identifies potential areas of disagreement with the area being reviewed and makes recommendations to minimize formal non-concurrences; considers and resolves issues on factual matters to ensure balanced and accurate results; develops and implements follow-up plans to track implementation of oversight work results; and tracks and reports on follow-up activities, as required. Utilizes the knowledge of the work product and planned programs to assist senior leaders in the preparation and presentation of complex materials or highly complex issues before a wide variety of audiences. When tasked, will undertake special studies, direct projects, and carry out assigned missions of the very highest priority, many of which are of direct concern to the agency. In this connection, incumbent is relied upon to plan, direct, coordinate, and expedite projects and actions appropriate for each assignment. Establishes and maintains highly effective working relationships with all stakeholders. Analyze financial and other data, including revenue, expenditure, and employment reports. Conduct onsite observations to determine the methods, equipment, and personnel that will be needed. Excellent writing and editing skills are required to provide comprehensive support to the production of complex and comprehensive publications. Must be able to identify, gather, and evaluate data; identify source documents and prepare requests for information; provide support and have the ability to analyze and evaluate multi-national program operations. Knowledge of qualitative and quantitative analysis techniques to conduct data calls and perform research. Proficiency in analyzing data and information to identify issues and develop conclusions and recommendations.

raw_data.title: Secretary I
raw_data.description: This position provides principal secretarial support in an office, usually to one individual, and, in some cases, to the subordinate staff of that individual. The Secretary maintains a close and highly responsive relationship to the day-to-day activities of the supervisor and staff, works independently receiving a minimum of detailed supervision and guidance, and performs various clerical and secretarial duties requiring knowledge of office routine and an understanding of the organization, programs, and procedures related to the work of the office. Computers may exist in the environment, requiring working knowledge of certain office software programs. Respond to routine telephone requests that have standard answers. Refer calls and visitors to appropriate staff. Control mail and assure timely staff response and send form letters. As instructed, maintain supervisor's calendar, make appointments, and arrange for meeting rooms. Review materials prepared for supervisor's approval for typographical accuracy and proper format. Maintain recurring internal reports, such as time and leave records, office equipment listings, correspondence controls, and training plans. Requisition supplies, printing, maintenance or other services, type, take and transcribe dictation, create and maintain office files. Strong customer service skills. Ability to multitask. Strong communication skills both written and verbal.
raw_data.education_and_experience_substitution: Two (2) years of experience is equal to an Associate’s Degree, four (4) years of experience is equal to a Bachelor’s Degree, six (6) years of experience is equal to a Master’s Degree, and vice versa.

raw_data.title: Subject Matter Expert I
raw_data.description: The Subject Matter Exert (SME) will be responsible for drafting, editing and maintaining and distributing all associated contract documents throughout the contract acquisition life-cycle. The SME will be familiar with various Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), Department of State Acquisition Regulations (DOSAR) and various Federal Government policies and procedures. The SME will manage tasks in accordance with approved internal processes and will provide technical recommendations as required. Provides coordination with all departments as necessary in the preparation of responses to Government and Contractor correspondence and other requests. Maintains close, professional interface with internal and external customer personnel to include technical, administrative, Government and Contractor. Reviews, recommends terms and conditions, ensuring company’s best interest in terms and conditions. Ensures contract files are maintained in an up-to-date and audit ready condition with all contractual data, correspondence and status. Maintains working knowledge of Federal and Commercial contract rules and regulations. Ensures compliance with contractual commitments from various stakeholders. Monitors, in conjunction with the Program Manager, performance against the original cost allocation and contract requirements in order to anticipate necessary changes in contract funding or scope of work. Assists Finance in accuracy of contractual requirements. Initiates with the Program Manager, contract close out process and completion of deliverables. Ensures that all contract status documents are maintained in a current and accurate manner. Ability to problem solve – applying originality, creativity and initiative. Strong planning, writing and organizational skills. Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and execute assigned workload to meet multiple deadlines. Detail-oriented without losing sight of the overall big picture. Ability to interpret considerable data of a technical/programmatic nature in order to effectively and adequately perform duties and responsibilities. Collaborate effectively with co-workers; work with other departments and management in a professional manner. Expert in Microsoft Office and Adobe.

raw_data.title: Technical Writer/Editor I
raw_data.description: The Technical editor and is responsible for performing technical editing and analytic trade craft reviews of organization’s written and graphic based products; ensures all written and graphic-based products are clearly written and accuracy; ensures all products are consistent with agency policy and meet the style requirements of the department and are written at an appropriate level for the intended audience. Prepare products developed by others for publication by making sure the material conveys what it was intended to say, is arranged logically, presents the facts to support the conclusions drawn, is in accordance with agency policy, and is written clearly and interestingly for the intended audience. Perform research, conduct investigations, or carry out operations in specialized fields such as the nature and social sciences, engineering, and physical sciences. Produce original papers, articles, or reports in scientific, technical, or professional fields based on research, interviews with experts and program officials, and sometimes observation of or participation in tests and experiments. Collaborate with other agencies offices and activities, and offices on policy, planning, scheduling, preparation, verification, and printing of publications. Strong writing skills; Familiarity with electronic publishing, graphics, Web design, and multimedia production. Must be creative, curious, and knowledgeable in a broad range of topics. Detail oriented and strong judgement. Strong interpersonal skills.
